# Introduction {-}

The College Scorecard is a project of post-secondary school information aggregated, distributed, and maintained by the U.S. Department of Education.

> The primary purpose of the Scorecard is to provide data to help prospective postsecondary students 
make informed enrollment decisions
>
> --- Technical Documentation of the College Scorecard Data

Our project seeks to isolate specific variables to answer the following questions:
1. Do specific degrees translate to higher earnings later in life?
2. Do more expensive schools translate to higher earnigns later in life?
